commentBody:
My hat is off to the citizens and politicians of the Los Angeles area, who refused to finance the construction of a new professional football stadium. L.A. got its priorities right on this one.

NFL owners, the relocation problem has an easy solution: Build one new stadium in Inglewood, to be shared by the Rams and Chargers. Allow the Raiders to share the stadium in Santa Clara with the 49ers. One new stadium gets built, and three franchises move into better homes. California, the nation's most populous state by far, ends up with four NFL football teams. And the taxpayer does not get stuck with the tab. Problem solved. Next question?
